history.text: hi
hello
have you seen despicable me?
ohh I sure have! Its a great movie! I have seen the second one as well.

did you know The title
references the main character as he refers to himself, and is accompanied by a song by Pharrell.
no I did not
yeah its totally true!
what other fun facts do you know?

The film was animated by the French animation studio
Mac Guff, which was later acquired by Illumination Entertainment.[6] It was directed by Pierre
Coffin and Chris Renaud as their feature debut film, with a story by Sergio Pablos.
oh wow, you really know your stuff
let me tell you a little more about what happens in the movie since you have seen it and I wont spoil anything
alright, sounds good.

Gru, a supervillain, is disheartened when an unknown supervillain steals the Great Pyramid
of Giza. Gru, with the assistance of his colleague Dr. Nefario and his Minions, resolves to
one-up this mystery rival by shrinking and stealing the Moon.
right, thats a main key story plot

As it would be costly to steal
the moon, Gru seeks a loan from the Bank of Evil. Bank president Mr. Perkins is impressed
by the plan but will provide the money only if Gru can obtain the necessary shrink ray first.
Upon learning that an up-and-coming villain named Vector was responsible for the pyramid
theft, Gru starts a rivalry with him.
hehe its like im watching the movie all over again almost

Eventually, Gru and the girls arrive at Vector's fortress, and Gru steals the shrink ray. The
girls then suggest a day at a theme park; Gru agrees, believing he can abandon the girls
there, but instead he warms up to them. Later, Gru contacts Perkins via video chat, stating
that he finally has the shrink ray.
are you going to tell me the whole story?

ray. Margo, Edith, and Agnes interrupt the meeting, and
Perkins announces that he has lost confidence in Gru and will no longer fund his
operations. As Gru tells the Minions he can no longer pay them for their services, the girls
offer the contents of their piggy bank. Gru, inspired, sells parts of his lair to construct a
spacecraft. Gru plans to steal the Moon when it is nearest the Earth, but this is the same
day as the girls' ballet recital. Gru becomes conflicted, and Dr. Nefario, seeing the recital as
interfering with the plan, arranges for the girls to be returned to the orphanage.
yeah I know, lol.

BUT WAIT!!! it gets better!! At the same
time, Perkins informs Vector, revealed to be Perkins' son, of Gru's possession of the shrink
ray and the adoption of the three girls, encouraging Vector to act.
how would you sumarize the credits?
hah... funny...  any wayss.... its a great movie for families with kids. My kiddo will sit and watch this allowing mommy and daddy to be free to tend to other things
I have definitely used that strategy before! my kids just love anything with minions
I understand how it goes, both my daughter AND my wife dressed as minions last halloween.
ohhh haha that is just too funny

well let me continue with the plot. Gru successfully shrinks and steals the Moon, and rushes back to Earth to attend the
recital—only to find a ransom note from Vector, who has kidnapped the girls. After arriving
at Vector's headquarters, Gru surrenders the Moon, but Vector reneges on the deal, flying
off with the girls and the Moon. Meanwhile,
are you just copying and pasting this information? it kinds of seams like it.
yes, why yes I am (=
